translation.en: On July 10th, 1943,
a unit from Oklahoma,
composed of Mexican- Americans, Native Americans and Dust Bowl cowboys,
translation.es: compuesta por mexicoamericanos, nativoamericanos y vaqueros del Dust Bowl

translation.en: most of whom couldn't drink together in the same bars back home,
translation.es: que ni siquiera podían compartir en el mismo bar en su país,

translation.en: landed in Sicily and began a brutal 500- day trek through Nazi- occupied Europe.
translation.es: llegó a Sicilia y comenzó un viaje brutal de 500 días por la Europa ocupada por los nazis.

translation.en: This is the story of those men.
translation.es: Esta es la historia de esos hombres.

translation.en: A group of soldiers known… as the Thunderbirds.
translation.es: Un grupo de soldados conocido como los Thunderbirds.

translation.en: How the hell can Coldfoot see anything? I can't even see my fuckin' boots.
translation.es: ¿Cómo hace Piefrío para ver? Ni siquiera me veo las botas.

translation.en: - What's he lookin' at? - He's looking at the fog.
The fog? What the fuck does that mean? We can all see the fog.
Shut up, Spigs.
Just make sure you can see him. Yes, sir, Captain.
translation.es: - Asegúrate de verlo a él. - Sí, capitán.

translation.en: - Get down! -
- Spigs, get down! - I'm tryin'! Ah! Shit! I'm hit. Fuck!
Oh, fuck.
Two Panzers, four platoons of infantry, 500 yards ahead.
translation.es: Dos Panzers, cuatro pelotones, a 500 metros.

translation.en: Fall back to that ridge.
E Company, fall back!
Incoming coordinates. - 2- 6… -
Nagles, shut up!
All right. Let's go, Nagles, come on!
No, no, no! Don't go under the trees. Stay out in the open!
translation.es: ¡No vayan bajo los árboles! ¡Quédense a cielo abierto!

translation.en: Thanks, Cap.
Garcia, Rosa, check out that barn.
They fell back two miles south and they're still moving.
What's our damage? Six dead or missing. At least ten wounded.
translation.es: - ¿Daños? - Seis desaparecidos y unos diez heridos.

translation.en: I wanna know where the Germans are sleeping tonight.
Look out for booby traps.
Watch your feet.
Shit! What was that?
A rat?
Nah, man. Too big.
Must be a dog.
He was hiding in the barn, sir. He won't shut up.
translation.es: Estaba en el granero. No se calla.

translation.en: We need Spigs to tell us what the hell he's saying.
Found this in his hiding place.
All right, get him inside. Get some food in him.
Where the hell is Spigs?
Spigliani. - Do you speak Italian? - Yes.
- Charlestown, Massachusetts. -
- But you know Boston? - Mh- hmm.
Boston.
Park the car in Harvard Yard.
Fenway Park.
Paul Revere.
Where did you learn to swim, Private Spigliani?
Fuck.
- Swim? - No, let me guess.
The boys' club on 2nd Street.
translation.es: En el club de la calle Dos.

translation.en: Yeah.
How the hell do you know that?
I told you.
I was a graduate student at MIT.
I lived on Maple, near the intersection of 4th.
translation.es: Vivía en la calle Maple y la Cuatro.

translation.en: And I dated a girl…
named Hammel…
Gloria.
She had these… beautiful breasts.
Sparky Hammel's sister, yeah.
Damn!
You and me in Charlestown at the boys' club.
translation.es: Usted y yo en Charlestown, en el club de chicos.

translation.en: - It's a small world, isn't it? - You can say that again.
translation.es: - Qué chico es el mundo, ¿no? - Así es.

translation.en: Akacheta.
Carmona.
Kawacatoose.
Indians and Mexicans
and a wop from Boston?
Yeah. 157th Regiment from Oklahoma.
I got attached at Salerno as an interpreter.
translation.es: Me alisté en Salerno como intérprete.

translation.en: And their leader, he is an Indian, too?
Capt. Sparks? No.
He's a cowboy. From Arizona.
Things must be getting desperate in America if they're allowing these types into your army.
translation.es: En EE. UU. deben estar desesperados para aceptar a estos tipos en el ejército.

translation.en: Red men and Mexicans. Inferior races.
We don't see 'em that way.
They're Americans.
Like me.
Really?
I've been to Oklahoma, Corporal,
and the bars have signs out front that say… No Indians Allowed. No Mexicans.
translation.es: y los bares tienen carteles que dicen: No se permiten indios ni mexicanos.

translation.en: I've also been to Georgia.
They make their Negroes there drink from separate water fountains.
translation.es: Hacen que los negros beban de fuentes de agua separadas.

translation.en: So don't tell me they're Americans just like you.
translation.es: Así que no me diga que son como usted.

translation.en: Strange.
To fight for a country where you can't even enjoy a beer…
translation.es: Luchar por un país donde no pueden beber una cerveza

translation.en: at the same bar as your fellow soldier.
translation.es: en el mismo bar que sus compañeros.

translation.en: So… please now tell me about the ponds.
translation.es: Así que, por favor, hábleme de los ponti.

translation.en: Ponds?
Yes, I need to know what you did about the ponds.
translation.es: Sí, necesito saber qué hicieron con los ponti.

translation.en: What ponds? I don't know what the hell you're talking about.
translation.es: ¿Qué ponti? No sé de qué está hablando.

translation.en: - Jesus Christ! - Ponds!
- What did you do with the ponds! - We didn't see any fucking ponds.
translation.es: - ¿Qué hicieron con los ponti? - No lo sé.

translation.en: - You're lying! - Jesus Christ, I'm telling you the truth.
Your company crossed three ponds in two days.
translation.es: Su compañía cruzó tres ponti en dos días.

translation.en: Here, here and here.
What are the conditions of those ponds?
Ponte. Br-- Bridges. You're talking about bridges.
translation.es: Ponte. Puentes. Se refiere a los puentes.

translation.en: Yes.
Bridges.
I used the Italian word, didn't I?
My mistake.
Jesus Christ.
What are the conditions of those bridges?
We didn't touch the bridges. They're all there.
translation.es: No tocamos los puentes. Están todos ahí.

translation.en: Relax, Spigliani.
The war for you is over.
You may even get to enjoy swimming in Charlestown again.
translation.es: Quizá pueda volver a nadar en Charlestown.

translation.en: But by this time tomorrow, your cowboy and Indian friends will all be dead.
translation.es: Pero mañana, sus amigos indios y el vaquero estarán todos muertos.

translation.en: Hey, Captain.
The kid's looking at the photos on your gun.
translation.es: El chico mira las fotos de su arma.

translation.en: My family.
Family. Do you understand?
Where's yours?
I have no family. Everyone is dead.
- Jesus. Does anybody here speak Italian? - Yeah.
Yeah, I know a little.
- He says his name is… -
We, uh, we got that part.
He says his, um, mother and father died.
translation.es: Dice que su madre y su padre murieron.

translation.en: He's been living here with his grandfather. Till he died.
translation.es: Vivía aquí con su abuelo, hasta que murió.

translation.en: He's been hiding from the Germans for the last month.
We lost them, sir. They're using the rain to screen their movements.
translation.es: Los perdimos, señor. Ocultan sus movimientos con la lluvia.

translation.en: Ask him if he knows where the Germans are.
He says he doesn't know.
He's lying.
Well, he's scared as shit, man.
- Jesus, Gomez, what did you do to him? - I didn't do anything.
- - What the hell's so funny?
Ah, the Germans, man. They told him that first we were gonna feed him
translation.es: Los alemanes le dijeron que le daríamos comida

translation.en: and then we were gonna do it to him.
translation.es: y luego se lo íbamos a hacer.

translation.en: Do what? Cut off his nuts.
Hey, man, tell him we're not interested.
translation.es: Dile que no nos interesa eso.

translation.en: - Tell him we already bagged our limit. - Tell him they're too small.
translation.es: - Dile que ya nos aburrimos de eso. - Y que son pequeñas.

translation.en: Tell him it's a lie.
Tell him the Germans aren't coming back. We guarantee it.
translation.es: Dile que los alemanes no volverán. Se lo garantizamos.

translation.en: Sir, are you sure you want me to tell him that?
Tell him those men…
are the grandsons of the greatest Indian warriors to roam the American Plains.
translation.es: son nietos de los mejores guerreros indios de las llanuras de EE. UU.

translation.en: They've killed mountain lion, hunted buffalo.
translation.es: Han matado pumas y han cazado búfalos.

translation.en: Tell him those men…
they're the descendants of the powerful Mexican army
translation.es: descienden del ejército mexicano que derrotó a los franceses

translation.en: that defeated the French on Cinco de Mayo.
translation.es: descienden del ejército mexicano que derrotó a los franceses el Cinco de Mayo.

translation.en: And those men…
they're sons of Texas Rangers…
translation.es: son hijos de los Rangers de Texas…

translation.en: who brought the rule of law to places where only killers and thieves lived before.
translation.es: que llevaron la ley adonde antes solo había asesinos y ladrones.

translation.en: Tell him the Nazis are never gonna hurt him again.
translation.es: Y que los nazis no volverán a lastimarlo.

translation.en: Because tomorrow, we're gonna find 'em and stop 'em.
There now. Doesn't that feel better?
No man should have to walk around covering his privates.
translation.es: Nadie debería temer por sus partes íntimas.

translation.en: He actually made the kid believe we could do it.
translation.es: Le hizo creer que podíamos hacerlo.

translation.en: Wasn't the kid he was convincing.
Sir?
A gift from our young friend.
It was his grandfather's. He wants you to have it.
translation.es: Era de su abuelo y quiere que lo tenga usted.

translation.en: I cut down the barrel to make it more practical.
He also told me where the Germans are.
translation.es: Y me dijo dónde están los alemanes.

translation.en: - Be safe out there. - See ya, kid.
Thank you. You're welcome.
Watch the grass in the middle.
It's not movin'.
Tank.
Panzer, two o'clock, 50 yards.
Let's go!
Come on!
Medic!
Get the Jeep.
Captain's been hit.
- We need to take him to a field hospital. - Hold this.
Gomez?
All right. Hang in there. Hang in there. Stay still. Come on!
- Get him outta here. Now! - Here we go. Come on. Get him up.
translation.es: - Sáquenlo de aquí. ¡Ahora! - Aquí vamos. Vamos. Levántenlo.

translation.en: Easy. Easy.
Keep that up.
Stop!
Go! Go!
At ease, Lieutenant.
It's not Honolulu, is it?
Honolulu's overrated, sir.
Really?
Don't spoil my fantasy.
Finished a stint in Hawaii, then three years of college.
translation.es: Estuvo en Hawái y luego estudió tres años ahí.

translation.en: Why'd you re- enlist? I ran out of money, sir.
translation.es: - ¿Por qué se realista? - Me quedé sin dinero, señor.

translation.en: Give the Army another couple of years, then go back and graduate.
translation.es: Piensa servir un par de años más, y luego regresar y graduarse.

translation.en: That's the plan, sir.
You did hear there might be a war on the horizon?
I caught wind of that, yes, sir.
If that happens, we're gonna need every good officer we can get our hands on.
translation.es: De ser así, necesitaremos a todos los oficiales posibles.

translation.en: If that happens, I intend to be one of them, sir.
translation.es: Pretendo ser uno de ellos, señor.

translation.en: What got you in the Army in the first place?
A sandwich, sir.
I had to leave home when I was 17.
translation.es: Me fui de casa a los 17 años.

translation.en: Hunted all over the west for work, ended up skinny and starving in San Francisco.
translation.es: Busqué trabajo y terminé flaco y muerto de hambre en San Francisco.

translation.en: Army recruiter bought me a meal, said that if I signed up, I'd get three just like it every day.
translation.es: Un reclutador me alimentó y dijo que podría comer a diario.

translation.en: Your previous CO said you're good at handling problems.
translation.es: Su último superior dijo que resuelve problemas.

translation.en: Well, I've got one. One of my companies, J Company,
translation.es: Bueno, tengo uno. La Compañía J reprobó todas las pruebas de tiro

translation.en: has failed every live fire test for the past three months.
translation.es: La Compañía J reprobó todas las pruebas de tiro los últimos tres meses.

translation.en: - Do you think you can shape them up? - Yes, sir.
Good.
You've got one week.
Hey.
- I'm looking for J Company. - Uh, over there.
translation.es: - Busco la Compañía J. - Por allá.

translation.en: Turn off that fucking gringo music.
- - As you were, Corporal.
Who's in charge here?
- Um, Lt. Danalli, sir. - Lt. Danalli is now relieved.
translation.es: - El Tte. Danalli, señor. - Ha sido relevado.

translation.en: My name is Sparks. I want a list of all prisoners and charges.
translation.es: Me llamo Sparks. Quiero una lista de prisioneros y cargos.

translation.en: Uh, right away, sir.
Follow me, sir.
Cordosa.
Drunk and disorderly.
Red Feather.
Assault and battery.
Gomez.
Assaulting an officer.
Hallowell.
Assaulting an officer.
We get a lot of that in here.
Why are the men segregated?
The Indians and the Mexicans don't like each other much. And they both hate us more.
translation.es: Los indios y los mexicanos no se llevan bien y ambos nos odian.

translation.en: Open the doors.
Sir?
Open the doors, Corporal.
Cordosa, Miguel.
Clovis, New Mexico. There's a river down there, the Caheesh.
translation.es: Clovis, Nueva México. Hay un río allá, el Caheesh.

translation.en: Fishing any good?
What's that?
Gila trout.
It's the best in the world.
Hallowell.
Wilsall, Montana. Sheep country.
translation.es: Wilsall, Montana. Un campo de ovejas.

translation.en: What do you do about the wolves?
We shoot 'em.
You any good at that?
I never miss.
Gomez.
Who the hell gave you that? My brother.
translation.es: - ¿Quién diablos te hizo eso? - Mi hermano.

translation.en: Shit, I don't want you. I want him.
translation.es: Mierda, lo quiero a él, no a ti.

translation.en: Coldfoot.
Private Samuel Coldfoot.
My name is Lt. Sparks.
The fact that I'm talking to you in a jailhouse
tells me you didn't get on well with your previous COs.
translation.es: indica que no se llevaban bien con sus superiores.

translation.en: Maybe you were told you're too stupid for this army.
translation.es: Quizá les dijeron que son estúpidos,

translation.en: Maybe you were told you got a problem with authority or…
translation.es: que tienen problemas con la autoridad o…

translation.en: maybe…
you were told you come from a race…
that's got no business wearing the uniform.
translation.es: que no debería usar el uniforme.

translation.en: Whatever you've been told doesn't mean shit to me.
translation.es: No me importa nada de eso.

translation.en: What matters to me… is performance.
There's a live fire test at the end of the week.
Pass it…
and you can enjoy a weekend of freedom.
translation.es: serán libres un fin de semana.

translation.en: Forty- eight hours, not only outside this cage…
translation.es: Unas 48 horas no solo fuera de esta jaula,

translation.en: but off- post.
But…
like everything else in life…
this privilege must be earned.
Now, if you feel
that you and the US Army have reached the end of your journey together,
translation.es: que ya no deben estar en el ejército de EE. UU.,

translation.en: do not waste my time.
translation.es: no me hagan perder el tiempo.

translation.en: Or anybody else's.
translation.es: Ni a mí ni a nadie.

translation.en: But if you want the chance to prove that everything that every asshole ever said about you is wrong…
translation.es: Pero si quieren demostrar que lo que dicen de ustedes es mentira…

translation.en: you got two minutes to lace up and join me outside.
translation.es: los veo afuera en dos minutos.

translation.en: Shall we give them another minute, sir?
No.
It doesn't take another minute to figure this out.
Lock 'em back up.
Who's missing?
Only Coldfoot, sir.
All right, Corporal.
- Line 'em up. - Were you bullshitting me
or can you really get us off- post?
translation.es: o de verdad puede sacarnos de aquí?

translation.en: Only if the whole group passes.
J Company, attention!
Marks.
Sir?
- What's the story with Coldfoot? - What story, sir?
He's been in the Army over three years. Why is he still a private?
translation.es: ¿Por qué es soldado si lleva años aquí?

translation.en: Coldfoot got demoted, sir.
He used to be corporal. Up for a promotion to sergeant.
translation.es: Era cabo y lo iban a ascender a sargento.

translation.en: What happened?
He got turned down.
He blamed some NCOs, and it ended in a big fight.
translation.es: Culpó a unos suboficiales y hubo una pelea.

translation.en: The colonel…
busted him down to private.
He got in a fight because he was denied promotion?
translation.es: ¿Se peleó porque le negaron el ascenso?

translation.en: It was his third rejection, sir.
Coldfoot is an Indian with pride, Lieutenant.
translation.es: Piefrío es un indio orgulloso de serlo, teniente.

translation.en: It's… it's not a very healthy combination around here.
translation.es: Aquí, eso no está bien visto.

translation.en: No wonder you feather- heads lost all your land.
translation.es: Con razón perdieron todas sus tierras, cabezas de pluma.

translation.en: Here I thought it was 'cause you couldn't hold your liquor.
translation.es: Pensé que había sido por ebrios.

translation.en: But all this time, it was 'cause you couldn't shoot worth a fuck.
translation.es: Pero solo fue porque disparan para la mierda.

translation.en: What mojado taught you to fire a gun, Gomez?
translation.es: ¿Qué frijolero le enseñó a disparar, Gomez?

translation.en: Was it your melon- pickin' mother?
You got a problem with something, boy?
Well…
will you look who's back, boys?
It's Corporal…  …I mean, Private Chillyfoot.
translation.es: El cabo… Digo, el soldado Piehelado.

translation.en: I thought we got rid of you, prairie nigger.
translation.es: Pensé que nos habíamos librado de ti, maldito.

translation.en: Trust me, it is just a matter of time--
Master Sergeant, can my men get a little more of your instruction
and a little less of your commentary?
translation.es: y menos comentarios a mis hombres?

translation.en: Beggin' your pardon, sir.
I forgot you're new around here.
See, this here is my firing range.
translation.es: Verá, este es mi campo de tiro.

translation.en: That means when your men step onto my range,
translation.es: Eso significa que cuando sus hombres entran a mi campo,

translation.en: they become my men.
That's funny, Sergeant, 'cause the way I see it is…
translation.es: Qué curioso, sargento, porque, de hecho,

translation.en: when I bring my men onto your range…
translation.es: cuando traigo a mis hombres a su campo,

translation.en: you become their instructor.
translation.es: usted se convierte en su instructor.

translation.en: So far, all they've gotten from you is a dissertation on their diets and the sexual habits of their mothers, so…
translation.es: Hasta ahora, solo ha hablado de sus dietas y de los hábitos sexuales de sus madres.

translation.en: how about doing a little work?
See, now,
where I come from,
a man don't toss words around like that…
translation.es: los hombres no tiran palabras al aire…

translation.en: unless he's willing to back them up.
translation.es: a menos que estén dispuestos a respaldarlas.

translation.en: What goes on behind that shed stays behind that shed.
translation.es: Lo que pasa detrás de ese cobertizo no sale de ahí.

translation.en: Very well, Sergeant.
Lead on.
You'd better start thinking how you're gonna explain these bruises, sir.
translation.es: Empiece a pensar cómo explicará sus moretones, señor.

translation.en: What bruises?
Fair warning, boys. You go back there, you'll have company.
translation.es: Se los advierto: si van, irán acompañados.

translation.en: He still alive?
Barely.
Good.
I was wondering how I was gonna explain that.
Shall we pick up where we left off, gentlemen?
Attention!
Good work, Lieutenant.
- Best scores of any group. - Thank you, sir.
We credit the master sergeant with our success.
translation.es: El éxito se lo debemos al sargento mayor.

translation.en: Excellent work, Master Sergeant. Sorry to hear about your little accident.
translation.es: Excelente trabajo, sargento. Lamento lo de su pequeño accidente.

translation.en: - Bring in the next group. - Yes, sir.
translation.es: - Traiga al otro grupo. - Sí, señor.

translation.en: Come in.
There's a problem with Coldfoot. He's going into town.
- Yeah, he's got a pass. - It's where he's going that's a problem.
translation.es: - Sí, puede ir. - El problema es adónde irá.

translation.en: Whatever you're planning…
don't.
They'll only call the MPs, have you thrown in jail.
What'll that prove? That nothing in this army leads to anything good.
translation.es: - ¿Qué lograrás así? - Que el ejército no lleva a nada bueno.

translation.en: That's not true.
What if I told you I'd put you up for sergeant this week?
No offense, Lieutenant, but I've been up for sergeant before.
translation.es: Sin ofender, pero ya lo han hecho.

translation.en: You wait and wait and then they give you an excuse and tell you no.
translation.es: Esperas, te dan una excusa y dicen que no.

translation.en: - I ain't waiting anymore. - You don't have to.
translation.es: - Ya no esperaré. - No es necesario.

translation.en: Get in the car, Sergeant Coldfoot.
Is that your wife, Captain?
Yeah.
Lucky man.
On a lot of fronts.
The shrapnel went through your abdomen and sliced open your liver.
translation.es: La metralla entró por el abdomen y dañó el hígado.

translation.en: - You wanna tell me what the lucky part is? - You should be dead.
Quick action by your men saved your life.
translation.es: Sus hombres le salvaron la vida.

translation.en: If you ever see them again, I suggest taking them out for a steak dinner.
translation.es: Si vuelve a verlos, sugiero que los invite a cenar.

translation.en: Speaking of seeing them…
when do I go back to Italy?
Maybe after the war. Your combat days are over, Captain.
translation.es: Quizá después de la guerra. Sus días al frente terminaron, capitán.

translation.en: Next stop for you is home.
Congratulations, Captain. You've got a million- dollar wound.
translation.es: Felicitaciones, capitán. Su herida lo llevará a casa.

translation.en: Italy,1944.
With winter setting in, the fighting south of Rome continues.
translation.es: Con la llegada del invierno, la lucha al sur de Roma continúa.

translation.en: Allied troops are dug in, waiting for the next German counterattack,
translation.es: Las tropas aliadas esperan el próximo contrataque alemán,

translation.en: which is expected any day.
translation.es: que llegará un día de estos.

translation.en: The going is tough, but so are our boys.
translation.es: La situación es dura, pero los muchachos son fuertes.

translation.en: Ask any one of them and they'll tell you
translation.es: Pregúntenle a cualquiera y le dirán

translation.en: it'll take a lot more than a little rain and mud
translation.es: que se necesita más que lluvia y lodo

translation.en: to get these GI Joes down.
I need transportation, Captain. I'm not that damn particular. You'll do.
translation.es: Necesito un transporte, capitán. No tengo preferencias.

translation.en: Okay, now that you've seen it…
I'm thirsty. Let's get a drink.
It happened a week after you were wounded.
translation.es: Fue una semana después de su herida.

translation.en: My Jeep hit a mine.
translation.es: Mi yip chocó contra una mina.

translation.en: It threw me 20 feet in the air, took off everything below the knee.
translation.es: Volé por el aire y perdí todo por debajo de la rodilla.

translation.en: Congratulations on your stars, sir.
Thank you.
Truth is, Felix… in this war, getting promoted is easy.
translation.es: La verdad es que, Felix, es fácil que te asciendan en esta guerra.

translation.en: The hard part is staying alive.
Any news on the 157?
They're stuck on the Gustav Line south of Cassino.
translation.es: Están atrapados en la Línea Gustav, al sur de Cassino.

translation.en: It's cold, wet and shitty. They're hangin' tough.
translation.es: Es frío, húmedo… una mierda. Están resistiendo.

translation.en: Who'd you send in for me?
Kettleman.
He's a good soldier.
He's not you, but he's okay.
translation.es: No como tú, pero es bueno.

translation.en: When are they, uh, sending you home, sir?
Next week. I was going to offer to take any letters back for you,
translation.es: La próxima semana. Iba a ofrecerte llevar algunas cartas,

translation.en: but I hear that won't be necessary.
translation.es: pero oí que no será necesario.

translation.en: You're right after me.
Yeah.
Don't act excited or anything.
I know this sounds crazy.
I feel I should be in Italy. I oughta be with my men.
translation.es: pero quisiera regresar a Italia con mis hombres.

translation.en: Go home, Felix. Go home to Mary.
translation.es: Ve a casa con Mary, Felix.

translation.en: See your son, raise more babies.
translation.es: Ve a tu hijo, ten más bebés.

translation.en: You've done your duty.
Safe travels, sir. See you back home, Felix.
translation.es: - Buen viaje, señor. - Nos vemos en casa, Felix.

translation.en: My dearest Mary…
I've never been a good letter writer, so I don't know if I can explain this.
translation.es: nunca he sido buen escritor, así que no sé si podré explicar esto.

translation.en: Hell, I'm not sure I can explain it even to myself.
translation.es: Ni siquiera puedo explicármelo a mí mismo.

translation.en: When I left you to come over here, I was scared of losing you.
translation.es: Cuando te dejé para venir aquí, temía perderte.

translation.en: Scared of not coming back.
Scared of dying.
I'm not scared anymore.
Sir?
There's an Army captain out there.
translation.es: Hay un capitán del ejército afuera.

translation.en: He wants to hitch a ride back to Italy.
I guess the only way to explain my decision is that it isn't my time to come home yet.
translation.es: Creo que la única explicación es que aún no es hora de regresar.

translation.en: Captain, what are you doing?
What's it look like I'm doing, Doc?
You're not ready for discharge.
translation.es: No está listo para el alta.

translation.en: You walk out of here, Captain, you'll be AWOL.
- Take care, kid. - Captain!
I know you want me home. Make no mistake, I wanna be home.
translation.es: Sé que quieres que regrese. Y yo quiero estar en casa.

translation.en: Desperately.
I wanna hold my son in my arms
translation.es: Tener a mi hijo en brazos

translation.en: and lay with you on a quiet desert night beneath the stars.
translation.es: y acostarme contigo, tranquilos, bajo las estrellas.

translation.en: But I owe something to a group of men.
translation.es: Pero le debo algo a unos hombres.

translation.en: Men who… before the war…
translation.es: Hombres que, antes de la guerra,

translation.en: I'd probably never have known,
and now I know as well as I know myself.
translation.es: y ahora los conozco tanto como a mí mismo.

translation.en: If I came home, I could never live with myself,
translation.es: Si regreso, no me perdonaré haberlos dejado

translation.en: knowing I owed a debt to them and ignored it.
So I have to complete this journey I've started.
translation.es: Así que debo completar el viaje que comencé.

translation.en: I cannot quit.
Anything less would leave a hole in my conscience that I could never repair.
translation.es: Si no, mi consciencia jamás me dejará en paz.

translation.en: Capt. Sparks, 157th Regiment, 2nd Battalion.
Orders, Captain.
I was just released from a hospital in North Africa, sir.
translation.es: Salí del hospital en el norte de África, señor.

translation.en: I was hoping to be reassigned to my old company.
What happened to your orders, Captain?
I didn't like 'em, sir.
They were to send me home.
Mary, I don't expect you to understand.
translation.es: Mary, no espero que lo entiendas.

translation.en: I'm having a hard time understanding it myself.
translation.es: Incluso a mí me cuesta entenderlo.

translation.en: But I have never been more sure of anything in my life and I have to trust that.
translation.es: Pero nunca he estado más seguro de nada y debo confiar en eso.

translation.en: So, please…
my darling Mary…
my dearest wife…
forgive me.
Get back to your foxhole, soldier. That's an order.
translation.es: Regrese a su trinchera. Es una orden.

translation.en: Dios mio, it's the captain.
What are you looking at, Sergeant?
- - Give me your report.
♪ Just before the sunrise ♪
♪ Hearts are breaking All the way to hell ♪
